alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Overton; Putnam; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 8:45PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Overton, northwestern Cumberland, northeastern White and southeastern Putnam Counties through 915 PM CST... At 844 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Monterey, or 11 miles northeast of Sparta, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Monterey and Pleasant Hill. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 302 and 321. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
